trans-unit.source: Represents a set of proposed changes to a running workflow instance.
All proposed changes to a running workflow instance must be made using a <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.WorkflowChanges> object.

When a <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.WorkflowChanges> object is constructed in application code (outside the workflow instance), the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity> object that is passed to the constructor must be the object that is returned by the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowInstance.GetWorkflowDefinition%2A> method of the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowInstance> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.WorkflowChanges"></xref> class.
The root <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity"></xref> of the workflow.
rootActivity is a null reference (Visual Basic `Nothing`).
rootActivity is not a .
rootActivity is in design mode.
Specifies the condition that must be satisfied to apply the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.WorkflowChanges"></xref>.
This property can be set on a root activity to disallow dynamic updates to the running workflow.
When the property is set on the root activity, and condition evaluates to `false`, the dynamic updates are disallowed on the workflow instance.
If the condition evaluates to `true`, or the condition is not set, the dynamic updates are allowed.
Gets the condition property on a dependency object.
The <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.WorkflowChanges.ConditionProperty> is an attached dependency property, that is, it is declared and used by one type and set on another.
Therefore, there must be static `get` and `set` methods on the type declaring the property.
Helper method for getting <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.WorkflowChanges.ConditionProperty>.

A <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject"></xref> (or derived type) that contains a condition property, such as the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.SequentialWorkflowActivity"></xref> and <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.StateMachineWorkflowActivity"></xref> activities.
A condition property type, such as <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityCondition"></xref>.
dependencyObject is null (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
dependencyObject is not a or a type that derives from .
Sets the condition property on a dependency object.
The <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.WorkflowChanges.ConditionProperty> is an attached dependency property, that is, it is declared and used by one type and set on another.
Therefore, there must be static `get` and `set` methods on the type declaring the property.
Helper method for setting <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.WorkflowChanges.ConditionProperty>.

A <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject"></xref> (or derived type) that contains a condition property, such as the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.SequentialWorkflowActivity"></xref> and <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.StateMachineWorkflowActivity"></xref> activities.
The condition type to set on the dependency object, such as an <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityCondition"></xref>.
Returns a cloned activity tree to which changes can be made and then applied to the running workflow instance.
A <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.CompositeActivity"></xref> that contains the cloned root activity for the workflow.

Validates the current set of proposed changes that have been made to the activity tree represented by the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.WorkflowChanges.TransientWorkflow"></xref> property.
A <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Compiler.ValidationErrorCollection"></xref> object that contains any errors or warnings that occurred during validation.
